extends com.phunware.core.CoreModule
    Implementation of CoreModule for the Core Module.

      static void validateManifestCoreSetup(android.content.Context context)
      A proper configuration means: The permission for INTERNET is defined. The Core Service declaration exists. The OpenUDID service declaration exists.

      This method should be used during development time to verify that the manifest is properly set up, but it doesn't need to be called once the application is deployed to the users' device.

      • getInstance

        public static PwCoreModule getInstance()
        Return an instance of this module.
        Returns:
        an instance of this module.

      • validateManifestCoreSetup

        public static void validateManifestCoreSetup(android.content.Context context)
        A proper configuration means:
        1. The permission for INTERNET is defined.
        2. The Core Service declaration exists.
        3. The OpenUDID service declaration exists.

        This method should be used during development time to verify that the manifest is properly set up, but it doesn't need to be called once the application is deployed to the users' device.

        Parameters:
        context - Application context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This exception is thrown if the Core manifest conditions are not met.

      • registerLocationClient

        public void registerLocationClient(com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient locationClient)
        Register a LocationClient. This must not be null and it is recommended that the client be already connected when this is called. Unregister with a call to unregisterLocationClient(LocationClient).

        *Note: A reference to the Google Play Services library must be included in order to call this.

        Parameters:
        locationClient - The LocationClient to register.

      • unregisterLocationClient

        public void unregisterLocationClient(com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient locationClient)
        Unregister a LocationClient. This may be called at any time and does nothing if the parameter is null. Register a client with a call to registerLocationClient(LocationClient).

        *Note: A reference to the Google Play Services library must be included in order to call this.

        Parameters:
        locationClient - LocationClient to unregister.

      • getLocationClient

        public com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient getLocationClient()
                                                                 throws java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
        Return the currently registered LocationClient. This assumes only one is registered at a time.

        *Note: A reference to the Google Play Services library must be included in order to call this.

        Returns:
        A LocationClient or null if none are registered.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
